translated: â€œIn order to attain thatâ€ is also to be supplied here, since the Abhidharma is wisdom together with its following, which attains uncontaminated wisdom either directly or indirectly.

analyzed: de lta bas na gdon pa ni sems can dang sems can ma yin par ston pa zhes bya bar gsal bar gdon par bya'o //

original: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi 'byung ba chen po dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa dag ni zin pa yin la gzhan dag ni ma zin pa yin no //
analyzed: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi 'byung ba chen po dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa dag ni zin pa yin la gzhan dag ni ma zin pa yin no //
translated: Arisen from the cause of appropriated great elements means that the present great elements that are not distinct from the sense faculties are appropriated, while others are not appropriated.

original: 'di la rgyu zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag yod pas zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag yod pas zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //

original: 'di lta ste lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni phyi'i sprul pa mi dang 'dra ba yang lag pa dang ngag gi sgra 'byin par 'gyur te yang dbang po dang tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu
analyzed: 'di lta ste lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni phyi'i sprul pa mi dang 'dra ba yang lag pa dang ngag gi sgra 'byin par 'gyur te yang dbang po dang tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu
translated: For example, like the sound of hands and speech means that external emanations that resemble humans also emit the sound of hands and speech, but they are not appropriated because they arise as distinct from the sense faculties.

original: las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //

translated: If one speaks,

original: sprul pa thams cad smra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sprul pa thams cad smra bar 'gyur //

original: gcig po mi smrar gyur na ni //
analyzed: gcig po mi smrar gyur na ni //
translated: If one does not speak,

original: sprul pa thams cad mi smrar 'gyur //
analyzed: sprul pa thams cad mi smrar 'gyur //
translated: all emanations do not speak.

original: zhes 'byung ste phyi'i sprul pa'i sgra de yang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas mi gzung ngo //ğŸ”½'di lta ste rlung dang nags @23a * //

translated: The sound of external emanations is not grasped, because it arises from a cause consisting of unevaporated primary elements.

analyzed: tshal dang chu'i sgra lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is like the sound of wind, forest, and water.

translated: The phrase â€œit is likeâ€ is an example.

original: sems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
translated: The sound of sentient beings is the sound of verbal manifest action.

original: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can yin par ston pa ni sems can du ston pa ste ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgras ni 'di ni sems can yin no zhes bya bar shes par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can yin par ston pa ni sems can du ston pa ste ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgras ni 'di ni sems can yin no zhes bya bar shes par byed do //
translated: Sound that is indicative of sentient beings is that which causes one to understand that a sentient being exists.

original: ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra de las ma gtogs pa'i sgra gzhan ni lag pa'i sgra'i bar yang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa yin na sems can ma yin pa'i rgyud las skyes pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes rnam par bshad par 'gyur
analyzed: ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra de las ma gtogs pa'i sgra gzhan ni lag pa'i sgra'i bar yang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa yin na sems can ma yin pa'i rgyud las skyes pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes rnam par bshad par 'gyur
translated: The sound of speech that is indicative of sentient beings is not indicative of sentient beings, so what need is there to mention that sound not included in the sound of speech, such as the sound of hands?

original: ro // de ltar na zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba ni sems can du ston pa yang yin la sems can du ston pa ma yin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ro // de ltar na zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba ni sems can du ston pa yang yin la sems can du ston pa ma yin pa yang yin no //
translated: Thus sound that arises from the cause of the primary elements conjoined with mind is both indicative of sentient beings and not indicative of sentient beings.

original: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang sprul pa'i sgra ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi ngo bo nyid ni sems can du ston pa yin la /
analyzed: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang sprul pa'i sgra ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi ngo bo nyid ni sems can du ston pa yin la /
translated: Sound that arises from the cause of the primary elements not conjoined with mind is indicative of sentient beings, such as the sound of emanated speech that is the essence of the indicative aspect of speech.

original: de nyid kyi lag pa'i sgra dang rlung dang nags tshal la sogs pa'i sgra ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa yin pas sgra rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi lag pa'i sgra dang rlung dang nags tshal la sogs pa'i sgra ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa yin pas sgra rnam pa bzhi'o //

original: yang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: yang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad yin no //

original: ji ltar kha dog gi rdul phra rab gcig la zhes bya ba ni sgra ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba bzhin mtshan nyid rgyur byas pa ma yin te kha dog gi rdul phra rab bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //

translated: Even though it does not produce that desire in spring, it should be understood as cold because it is of the same type.ğŸ”½Because the result is figuratively designated to the cause.

translated: Thus, since the arising of a buddha is the cause of high status and definite goodness, it is called happiness.

analyzed: bstsags pa dag la ni 'jal lo zhes bya ba ni lci ba nyid phra mo yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is weighed in the case of accumulations, because subtle heaviness exists.

original: 'dir gzugs na spyod pa'i gos la sogs pa ni rten dang brten pa yod pa'i phyir lci ba nyid dang bcas pa yin te dper na rdza ma dang rgya shugs lta bu'o zhes rjes su dpag pa yin no //

translated: Here, clothing and so on in the form realm have heaviness because they are bases and possess objects, like a clay pot and a fig.ğŸ”½This is an inference.

original: phan par byed pa ni yod do lo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan par byed pa ni yod do lo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said that it is helpful.

original: lo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs bstan pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs ni de na ting nge 'dzin kho na phan par byed pa yin pas de na grang ba brtags pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The VaibhÄá¹£ika says: In that case, since concentration alone is beneficial, why consider cold there?

original: gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan ma la gtod pa na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan ma la gtod pa na'o //
translated: When its aspects are distinguished means when the signs of the aspects of blue, etc., are focused on.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang 'di sgra rnam pa mang po bshad pa de la res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed de /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang 'di sgra rnam pa mang po bshad pa de la res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed de /
translated: The ear consciousness, etc., should be understood in the same way means that in the explanation of the many types of sound, sometimes one substance generates an ear consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o //
translated: When its aspects are distinguished means when the signs of the aspects of sound, etc., are focused on.

original: res 'ga' ni mang po ste gang gi tshe bye brag tu mi gcod pa na ste dper @24a * //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mang po ste gang gi tshe bye brag tu mi gcod pa na ste dper @24a * //
translated: Sometimes many generate it when its aspects are not distinguished, for example, when one hears the sound of an orchestra.

original: na rnga'i sgra'i tshogs dang sgra chen po dang sgra gdangs snyan pa du ma'i ngo bo nyan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: na rnga'i sgra'i tshogs dang sgra chen po dang sgra gdangs snyan pa du ma'i ngo bo nyan pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like listening to the sound of a lute, which has many aspects such as the sound of the strings, the sound of the body of the lute, and the sound of the drum.

original: de bzhin du sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang rang gi yul dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang rang gi yul dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the nose and tongue consciousnesses, which are associated with their own objects.

original: shin tu mang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag kyang 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa gcig dang reg bya lngas bskyed do zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu mang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag kyang 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa gcig dang reg bya lngas bskyed do zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If there are many, then the four great elements generate the five tangible objects such as softness, etc.

original: res 'ga' rdzas gcig gis bskyed de gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod pa na'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' rdzas gcig gis bskyed de gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod pa na'o //
translated: Sometimes one substance generates them, when the form of the tangible object is distinguished.

original: res 'ga' ni gnyis nas lnga'i bar gyis te gang gi tshe bye brag tu mi gcod pa na'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyis nas lnga'i bar gyis te gang gi tshe bye brag tu mi gcod pa na'o //
translated: Sometimes two up to five generate them, when the form of the tangible object is not distinguished.

original: 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa gcig dang zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ce na rtsub pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa gcig dang zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ce na rtsub pa nyid la sogs pa ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is the reason for saying that one tangible object such as softness, etc. is generated by the four great elements? Roughness, etc. is based on another set of four great elements.

original: de ltar na spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa dag phyir bsdus te 'dzin par byed pas de spyi'i
analyzed: de ltar na spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa dag phyir bsdus te 'dzin par byed pas de spyi'i
translated: Thus, the mind consciousness is posited as the object of a universal because it engages the universal of its object.

original: mtshan nyid kyi yul can du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi yul can du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the mind consciousness engages the objects of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousness and apprehends them by subsuming them,

original: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhi po dag kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gis dmigs pa bzhi po de dag dang ches mang po dag spyir bsdus te 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhi po dag kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gis dmigs pa bzhi po de dag dang ches mang po dag spyir bsdus te 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir
translated: so too the four eye consciousnesses that focus on blue, yellow, red, and white focus on those four objects and many more by subsuming them in a general way.

original: de'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'gyur te //
analyzed: de'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'gyur te //
translated: Therefore they are posited as the object of a universal.

original: 'di'i dmigs pa gzugs kyi skye mched spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs pa gzugs kyi skye mched spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of that eye consciousness is the universal of the form base.

original: rnab dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rang gi yul dag dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnab dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rang gi yul dag dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses should be applied to their own objects.

translated: If it is accompanied by its retinue, it is included in the mental faculty and the entity base, because it has the nature of the five aggregates. The form that is the retinue of that nonattachment, which follows this assembly, is the form aggregate.
